33// Both D3D and Vulkan support the same set of standard sample positions for 1, 2, 4, 8, and 16
34// samples. See:
35//
36// - https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ff476218.aspx
37//
38// -
39// https://www.khronos.org/registry/vulkan/specs/1.1-extensions/html/vkspec.html#primsrast-multisampling
40using SamplePositionsArray = std::array<float, 32>;
41constexpr std::array<SamplePositionsArray, 5> kSamplePositions = {
42 {{{0.5f, 0.5f}},
43 {{0.75f, 0.75f, 0.25f, 0.25f}},
44 {{0.375f, 0.125f, 0.875f, 0.375f, 0.125f, 0.625f, 0.625f, 0.875f}},
45 {{0.5625f, 0.3125f, 0.4375f, 0.6875f, 0.8125f, 0.5625f, 0.3125f, 0.1875f, 0.1875f, 0.8125f,
46 0.0625f, 0.4375f, 0.6875f, 0.9375f, 0.9375f, 0.0625f}},
47 {{0.5625f, 0.5625f, 0.4375f, 0.3125f, 0.3125f, 0.625f, 0.75f, 0.4375f,
48 0.1875f, 0.375f, 0.625f, 0.8125f, 0.8125f, 0.6875f, 0.6875f, 0.1875f,
49 0.375f, 0.875f, 0.5f, 0.0625f, 0.25f, 0.125f, 0.125f, 0.75f,
50 0.0f, 0.5f, 0.9375f, 0.25f, 0.875f, 0.9375f, 0.0625f, 0.0f}}}};
51
52void CopyColor(gl::ColorF *color)
53{
54 // No-op
55}
56
57void PremultiplyAlpha(gl::ColorF *color)
58{
59 color->red *= color->alpha;
60 color->green *= color->alpha;
61 color->blue *= color->alpha;
62}
63
64void UnmultiplyAlpha(gl::ColorF *color)
65{
66 if (color->alpha != 0.0f)
67 {
68 float invAlpha = 1.0f / color->alpha;
69 color->red *= invAlpha;
70 color->green *= invAlpha;
71 color->blue *= invAlpha;
72 }
73}
74
75void ClipChannelsR(gl::ColorF *color)
76{
77 color->green = 0.0f;
78 color->blue = 0.0f;
79 color->alpha = 1.0f;
80}
81
82void ClipChannelsRG(gl::ColorF *color)
83{
84 color->blue = 0.0f;
85 color->alpha = 1.0f;
86}
87
88void ClipChannelsRGB(gl::ColorF *color)
89{
90 color->alpha = 1.0f;
91}
92
93void ClipChannelsLuminance(gl::ColorF *color)
94{
95 color->alpha = 1.0f;
96}
97
98void ClipChannelsAlpha(gl::ColorF *color)
99{
100 color->red = 0.0f;
101 color->green = 0.0f;
102 color->blue = 0.0f;
103}
104
105void ClipChannelsNoOp(gl::ColorF *color) {}
106
107void WriteUintColor(const gl::ColorF &color,
108 PixelWriteFunction colorWriteFunction,
109 uint8_t *destPixelData)
110{
111 gl::ColorUI destColor(
112 static_cast<unsigned int>(color.red * 255), static_cast<unsigned int>(color.green * 255),
113 static_cast<unsigned int>(color.blue * 255), static_cast<unsigned int>(color.alpha * 255));
114 colorWriteFunction(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t *>(&destColor), destPixelData);
115}
116
117void WriteFloatColor(const gl::ColorF &color,
118 PixelWriteFunction colorWriteFunction,
119 uint8_t *destPixelData)
120{
121 colorWriteFunction(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t *>(&color), destPixelData);
122}
123
124template <int cols, int rows, bool IsColumnMajor>
125inline int GetFlattenedIndex(int col, int row)
126{
127 if (IsColumnMajor)
128 {
129 return col * rows + row;
130 }
131 else
132 {
133 return row * cols + col;
134 }
135}
136
137template <typename T,
138 bool IsSrcColumnMajor,
139 int colsSrc,
140 int rowsSrc,
141 bool IsDstColumnMajor,
142 int colsDst,
143 int rowsDst>
144void ExpandMatrix(T *target, const GLfloat *value)
145{
146 static_assert(colsSrc <= colsDst && rowsSrc <= rowsDst, "Can only expand!");
147
148 constexpr int kDstFlatSize = colsDst * rowsDst;
149 T staging[kDstFlatSize] = {0};
150
151 for (int r = 0; r < rowsSrc; r++)
152 {
153 for (int c = 0; c < colsSrc; c++)
154 {
155 int srcIndex = GetFlattenedIndex<colsSrc, rowsSrc, IsSrcColumnMajor>(c, r);
156 int dstIndex = GetFlattenedIndex<colsDst, rowsDst, IsDstColumnMajor>(c, r);
157
158 staging[dstIndex] = static_cast<T>(value[srcIndex]);
159 }
160 }
161
162 memcpy(target, staging, kDstFlatSize * sizeof(T));
163}
164
165template <bool IsSrcColumMajor,
166 int colsSrc,
167 int rowsSrc,
168 bool IsDstColumnMajor,
169 int colsDst,
170 int rowsDst>
171void SetFloatUniformMatrix(unsigned int arrayElementOffset,
172 unsigned int elementCount,
173 GLsizei countIn,
174 const GLfloat *value,
175 uint8_t *targetData)
176{
177 unsigned int count =
178 std::min(elementCount - arrayElementOffset, static_cast<unsigned int>(countIn));
179
180 const unsigned int targetMatrixStride = colsDst * rowsDst;
181 GLfloat *target = reinterpret_cast<GLfloat *>(
182 targetData + arrayElementOffset * sizeof(GLfloat) * targetMatrixStride);
183
184 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
185 {
186 ExpandMatrix<GLfloat, IsSrcColumMajor, colsSrc, rowsSrc, IsDstColumnMajor, colsDst,
187 rowsDst>(target, value);
188
189 target += targetMatrixStride;
190 value += colsSrc * rowsSrc;
191 }
192}
193
194void SetFloatUniformMatrixFast(unsigned int arrayElementOffset,
195 unsigned int elementCount,
196 GLsizei countIn,
197 size_t matrixSize,
198 const GLfloat *value,
199 uint8_t *targetData)
200{
201 const unsigned int count =
202 std::min(elementCount - arrayElementOffset, static_cast<unsigned int>(countIn));
203
204 const uint8_t *valueData = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t *>(value);
205 targetData = targetData + arrayElementOffset * matrixSize;
206
207 memcpy(targetData, valueData, matrixSize * count);
208}
209} // anonymous namespace
210
211void RotateRectangle(const SurfaceRotation rotation,
212 const bool flipY,
213 const int framebufferWidth,
214 const int framebufferHeight,
215 const gl::Rectangle &incoming,
216 gl::Rectangle *outgoing)
217{
218 // GLES's y-axis points up; Vulkan's points down.
219 switch (rotation)
220 {
221 case SurfaceRotation::Identity:
222 // Do not rotate gl_Position (surface matches the device's orientation):
223 outgoing->x = incoming.x;
224 outgoing->y = flipY ? framebufferHeight - incoming.y - incoming.height : incoming.y;
225 outgoing->width = incoming.width;
226 outgoing->height = incoming.height;
227 break;
228 case SurfaceRotation::Rotated90Degrees:
229 // Rotate gl_Position 90 degrees:
230 outgoing->x = incoming.y;
231 outgoing->y = flipY ? incoming.x : framebufferWidth - incoming.x - incoming.width;
232 outgoing->width = incoming.height;
233 outgoing->height = incoming.width;
234 break;
235 case SurfaceRotation::Rotated180Degrees:
236 // Rotate gl_Position 180 degrees:
237 outgoing->x = framebufferWidth - incoming.x - incoming.width;
238 outgoing->y = flipY ? incoming.y : framebufferHeight - incoming.y - incoming.height;
239 outgoing->width = incoming.width;
240 outgoing->height = incoming.height;
241 break;
242 case SurfaceRotation::Rotated270Degrees:
243 // Rotate gl_Position 270 degrees:
244 outgoing->x = framebufferHeight - incoming.y - incoming.height;
245 outgoing->y = flipY ? framebufferWidth - incoming.x - incoming.width : incoming.x;
246 outgoing->width = incoming.height;
247 outgoing->height = incoming.width;
248 break;
249 default:
250 UNREACHABLE();
251 break;
252 }
253}
254
255PackPixelsParams::PackPixelsParams()
256 : destFormat(nullptr),
257 outputPitch(0),
258 packBuffer(nullptr),
259 offset(0),
260 rotation(SurfaceRotation::Identity)
261{}
262
263PackPixelsParams::PackPixelsParams(const gl::Rectangle &areaIn,
264 const angle::Format &destFormat,
265 GLuint outputPitchIn,
266 bool reverseRowOrderIn,
267 gl::Buffer *packBufferIn,
268 ptrdiff_t offsetIn)
269 : area(areaIn),
270 destFormat(&destFormat),
271 outputPitch(outputPitchIn),
272 packBuffer(packBufferIn),
273 reverseRowOrder(reverseRowOrderIn),
274 offset(offsetIn),
275 rotation(SurfaceRotation::Identity)
276{}
277
278void PackPixels(const PackPixelsParams &params,
279 const angle::Format &sourceFormat,
280 int inputPitchIn,
281 const uint8_t *sourceIn,
282 uint8_t *destWithoutOffset)
283{
284 uint8_t *destWithOffset = destWithoutOffset + params.offset;
285
286 const uint8_t *source = sourceIn;
287 int inputPitch = inputPitchIn;
288 int destWidth = params.area.width;
289 int destHeight = params.area.height;
290 int xAxisPitch = 0;
291 int yAxisPitch = 0;
292 switch (params.rotation)
293 {
294 case SurfaceRotation::Identity:
295 // The source image is not rotated (i.e. matches the device's orientation), and may or
296 // may not be y-flipped. The image is row-major. Each source row (one step along the
297 // y-axis for each step in the dest y-axis) is inputPitch past the previous row. Along
298 // a row, each source pixel (one step along the x-axis for each step in the dest
299 // x-axis) is sourceFormat.pixelBytes past the previous pixel.
300 xAxisPitch = sourceFormat.pixelBytes;
301 if (params.reverseRowOrder)
302 {
303 // The source image is y-flipped, which means we start at the last row, and each
304 // source row is BEFORE the previous row.
305 source += inputPitchIn * (params.area.height - 1);
306 inputPitch = -inputPitch;
307 yAxisPitch = -inputPitchIn;
308 }
309 else
310 {
311 yAxisPitch = inputPitchIn;
312 }
313 break;
314 case SurfaceRotation::Rotated90Degrees:
315 // The source image is rotated 90 degrees counter-clockwise. Y-flip is always applied
316 // to rotated images. The image is column-major. Each source column (one step along
317 // the source x-axis for each step in the dest y-axis) is inputPitch past the previous
318 // column. Along a column, each source pixel (one step along the y-axis for each step
319 // in the dest x-axis) is sourceFormat.pixelBytes past the previous pixel.
320 xAxisPitch = inputPitchIn;
321 yAxisPitch = sourceFormat.pixelBytes;
322 destWidth = params.area.height;
323 destHeight = params.area.width;
324 break;
325 case SurfaceRotation::Rotated180Degrees:
326 // The source image is rotated 180 degrees. Y-flip is always applied to rotated
327 // images. The image is row-major, but upside down. Each source row (one step along
328 // the y-axis for each step in the dest y-axis) is inputPitch after the previous row.
329 // Along a row, each source pixel (one step along the x-axis for each step in the dest
330 // x-axis) is sourceFormat.pixelBytes BEFORE the previous pixel.
331 xAxisPitch = -static_cast<int>(sourceFormat.pixelBytes);
332 yAxisPitch = inputPitchIn;
333 source += sourceFormat.pixelBytes * (params.area.width - 1);
334 break;
335 case SurfaceRotation::Rotated270Degrees:
336 // The source image is rotated 270 degrees counter-clockwise (or 90 degrees clockwise).
337 // Y-flip is always applied to rotated images. The image is column-major, where each
338 // column (one step in the source x-axis for one step in the dest y-axis) is inputPitch
339 // BEFORE the previous column. Along a column, each source pixel (one step along the
340 // y-axis for each step in the dest x-axis) is sourceFormat.pixelBytes BEFORE the
341 // previous pixel. The first pixel is at the end of the source.
342 xAxisPitch = -inputPitchIn;
343 yAxisPitch = -static_cast<int>(sourceFormat.pixelBytes);
344 destWidth = params.area.height;
345 destHeight = params.area.width;
346 source += inputPitch * (params.area.height - 1) +
347 sourceFormat.pixelBytes * (params.area.width - 1);
348 break;
349 default:
350 UNREACHABLE();
351 break;
352 }
353
354 if (params.rotation == SurfaceRotation::Identity && sourceFormat == *params.destFormat)
355 {
356 // Direct copy possible
357 for (int y = 0; y < params.area.height; ++y)
358 {
359 memcpy(destWithOffset + y * params.outputPitch, source + y * inputPitch,
360 params.area.width * sourceFormat.pixelBytes);
361 }
362 return;
363 }
364
365 PixelCopyFunction fastCopyFunc = sourceFormat.fastCopyFunctions.get(params.destFormat->id);
366
367 if (fastCopyFunc)
368 {
369 // Fast copy is possible through some special function
370 for (int y = 0; y < destHeight; ++y)
371 {
372 for (int x = 0; x < destWidth; ++x)
373 {
374 uint8_t *dest =
375 destWithOffset + y * params.outputPitch + x * params.destFormat->pixelBytes;
376 const uint8_t *src = source + y * yAxisPitch + x * xAxisPitch;
377
378 fastCopyFunc(src, dest);
379 }
380 }
381 return;
382 }
383
384 PixelWriteFunction pixelWriteFunction = params.destFormat->pixelWriteFunction;
385 ASSERT(pixelWriteFunction != nullptr);
386
387 // Maximum size of any Color<T> type used.
388 uint8_t temp[16];
389 static_assert(sizeof(temp) >= sizeof(gl::ColorF) && sizeof(temp) >= sizeof(gl::ColorUI) &&
390 sizeof(temp) >= sizeof(gl::ColorI) &&
391 sizeof(temp) >= sizeof(angle::DepthStencil),
392 "Unexpected size of pixel struct.");
393
394 PixelReadFunction pixelReadFunction = sourceFormat.pixelReadFunction;
395 ASSERT(pixelReadFunction != nullptr);
396
397 for (int y = 0; y < destHeight; ++y)
398 {
399 for (int x = 0; x < destWidth; ++x)
400 {
401 uint8_t *dest =
402 destWithOffset + y * params.outputPitch + x * params.destFormat->pixelBytes;
403 const uint8_t *src = source + y * yAxisPitch + x * xAxisPitch;
404
405 // readFunc and writeFunc will be using the same type of color, CopyTexImage
406 // will not allow the copy otherwise.
407 pixelReadFunction(src, temp);
408 pixelWriteFunction(temp, dest);
409 }
410 }
411}
412
413bool FastCopyFunctionMap::has(angle::FormatID formatID) const
414{
415 return (get(formatID) != nullptr);
416}
417
418PixelCopyFunction FastCopyFunctionMap::get(angle::FormatID formatID) const
419{
420 for (size_t index = 0; index < mSize; ++index)
421 {
422 if (mData[index].formatID == formatID)
423 {
424 return mData[index].func;
425 }
426 }
427
428 return nullptr;
429}
430
431bool ShouldUseDebugLayers(const egl::AttributeMap &attribs)
432{
433 EGLAttrib debugSetting =
434 attribs.get(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_DEBUG_LAYERS_ENABLED_ANGLE, EGL_DONT_CARE);
435
436 // Prefer to enable debug layers when available.
437#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_ASSERTS)
438 return (debugSetting != EGL_FALSE);
439#else
440 return (debugSetting == EGL_TRUE);
441#endif // defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_ASSERTS)
442}
443
444bool ShouldUseVirtualizedContexts(const egl::AttributeMap &attribs, bool defaultValue)
445{
446 EGLAttrib virtualizedContextRequest =
447 attribs.get(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_CONTEXT_VIRTUALIZATION_ANGLE, EGL_DONT_CARE);
448 if (defaultValue)
449 {
450 return (virtualizedContextRequest != EGL_FALSE);
451 }
452 else
453 {
454 return (virtualizedContextRequest == EGL_TRUE);
455 }
456}
457
458void CopyImageCHROMIUM(const uint8_t *sourceData,
459 size_t sourceRowPitch,
460 size_t sourcePixelBytes,
461 size_t sourceDepthPitch,
462 PixelReadFunction pixelReadFunction,
463 uint8_t *destData,
464 size_t destRowPitch,
465 size_t destPixelBytes,
466 size_t destDepthPitch,
467 PixelWriteFunction pixelWriteFunction,
468 GLenum destUnsizedFormat,
469 GLenum destComponentType,
470 size_t width,
471 size_t height,
472 size_t depth,
473 bool unpackFlipY,
474 bool unpackPremultiplyAlpha,
475 bool unpackUnmultiplyAlpha)
476{
477 using ConversionFunction = void (*)(gl::ColorF *);
478 ConversionFunction conversionFunction = CopyColor;
479 if (unpackPremultiplyAlpha != unpackUnmultiplyAlpha)
480 {
481 if (unpackPremultiplyAlpha)
482 {
483 conversionFunction = PremultiplyAlpha;
484 }
485 else
486 {
487 conversionFunction = UnmultiplyAlpha;
488 }
489 }
490
491 auto clipChannelsFunction = ClipChannelsNoOp;
492 switch (destUnsizedFormat)
493 {
494 case GL_RED:
495 clipChannelsFunction = ClipChannelsR;
496 break;
497 case GL_RG:
498 clipChannelsFunction = ClipChannelsRG;
499 break;
500 case GL_RGB:
501 clipChannelsFunction = ClipChannelsRGB;
502 break;
503 case GL_LUMINANCE:
504 clipChannelsFunction = ClipChannelsLuminance;
505 break;
506 case GL_ALPHA:
507 clipChannelsFunction = ClipChannelsAlpha;
508 break;
509 }
510
511 auto writeFunction = (destComponentType == GL_UNSIGNED_INT) ? WriteUintColor : WriteFloatColor;
512
513 for (size_t z = 0; z < depth; z++)
514 {
515 for (size_t y = 0; y < height; y++)
516 {
517 for (size_t x = 0; x < width; x++)
518 {
519 const uint8_t *sourcePixelData =
520 sourceData + y * sourceRowPitch + x * sourcePixelBytes + z * sourceDepthPitch;
521
522 gl::ColorF sourceColor;
523 pixelReadFunction(sourcePixelData, reinterpret_cast<uint8_t *>(&sourceColor));
524
525 conversionFunction(&sourceColor);
526 clipChannelsFunction(&sourceColor);
527
528 size_t destY = 0;
529 if (unpackFlipY)
530 {
531 destY += (height - 1);
532 destY -= y;
533 }
534 else
535 {
536 destY += y;
537 }
538
539 uint8_t *destPixelData =
540 destData + destY * destRowPitch + x * destPixelBytes + z * destDepthPitch;
541 writeFunction(sourceColor, pixelWriteFunction, destPixelData);
542 }
543 }
544 }
545}
546
547// IncompleteTextureSet implementation.
548IncompleteTextureSet::IncompleteTextureSet() {}
549
550IncompleteTextureSet::~IncompleteTextureSet() {}
551
552void IncompleteTextureSet::onDestroy(const gl::Context *context)
553{
554 // Clear incomplete textures.
555 for (auto &incompleteTexture : mIncompleteTextures)
556 {
557 if (incompleteTexture.get() != nullptr)
558 {
559 incompleteTexture->onDestroy(context);
560 incompleteTexture.set(context, nullptr);
561 }
562 }
563}
564
565angle::Result IncompleteTextureSet::getIncompleteTexture(
566 const gl::Context *context,
567 gl::TextureType type,
568 MultisampleTextureInitializer *multisampleInitializer,
569 gl::Texture **textureOut)
570{
571 *textureOut = mIncompleteTextures[type].get();
572 if (*textureOut != nullptr)
573 {
574 return angle::Result::Continue;
575 }
576
577 ContextImpl *implFactory = context->getImplementation();
578
579 const GLubyte color[] = {0, 0, 0, 255};
580 const gl::Extents colorSize(1, 1, 1);
581 gl::PixelUnpackState unpack;
582 unpack.alignment = 1;
583 const gl::Box area(0, 0, 0, 1, 1, 1);
584
585 // If a texture is external use a 2D texture for the incomplete texture
586 gl::TextureType createType = (type == gl::TextureType::External) ? gl::TextureType::_2D : type;
587
588 gl::Texture *tex =
589 new gl::Texture(implFactory, {std::numeric_limits<GLuint>::max()}, createType);
590 angle::UniqueObjectPointer<gl::Texture, gl::Context> t(tex, context);
591
592 // This is a bit of a kludge but is necessary to consume the error.
593 gl::Context *mutableContext = const_cast<gl::Context *>(context);
594
595 if (createType == gl::TextureType::_2DMultisample)
596 {
597 ANGLE_TRY(
598 t->setStorageMultisample(mutableContext, createType, 1, GL_RGBA8, colorSize, true));
599 }
600 else
601 {
602 ANGLE_TRY(t->setStorage(mutableContext, createType, 1, GL_RGBA8, colorSize));
603 }
604
605 if (type == gl::TextureType::CubeMap)
606 {
607 for (gl::TextureTarget face : gl::AllCubeFaceTextureTargets())
608 {
609 ANGLE_TRY(t->setSubImage(mutableContext, unpack, nullptr, face, 0, area, GL_RGBA,
610 GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, color));
611 }
612 }
613 else if (type == gl::TextureType::_2DMultisample)
614 {
615 // Call a specialized clear function to init a multisample texture.
616 ANGLE_TRY(multisampleInitializer->initializeMultisampleTextureToBlack(context, t.get()));
617 }
618 else
619 {
620 ANGLE_TRY(t->setSubImage(mutableContext, unpack, nullptr,
621 gl::NonCubeTextureTypeToTarget(createType), 0, area, GL_RGBA,
622 GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, color));
623 }
624
625 ANGLE_TRY(t->syncState(context, gl::Command::Other));
626
627 mIncompleteTextures[type].set(context, t.release());
628 *textureOut = mIncompleteTextures[type].get();
629 return angle::Result::Continue;
630}
631
632#define ANGLE_INSTANTIATE_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(api, cols, rows) \
633 template void SetFloatUniformMatrix##api<cols, rows>::Run( \
634 unsigned int, unsigned int, GLsizei, GLboolean, const GLfloat *, uint8_t *)
635
636ANGLE_INSTANTIATE_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(GLSL, 2, 2);
637ANGLE_INSTANTIATE_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(GLSL, 3, 3);
638ANGLE_INSTANTIATE_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(GLSL, 2, 3);
639ANGLE_INSTANTIATE_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(GLSL, 3, 2);
640ANGLE_INSTANTIATE_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(GLSL, 4, 2);
641ANGLE_INSTANTIATE_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(GLSL, 4, 3);
642
643ANGLE_INSTANTIATE_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(HLSL, 2, 2);
644ANGLE_INSTANTIATE_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(HLSL, 3, 3);
645ANGLE_INSTANTIATE_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(HLSL, 2, 3);
646ANGLE_INSTANTIATE_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(HLSL, 3, 2);
647ANGLE_INSTANTIATE_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(HLSL, 2, 4);
648ANGLE_INSTANTIATE_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(HLSL, 3, 4);
649
650#undef ANGLE_INSTANTIATE_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC
651
652#define ANGLE_SPECIALIZATION_ROWS_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(api, cols, rows) \
653 template void SetFloatUniformMatrix##api<cols, 4>::Run(unsigned int, unsigned int, GLsizei, \
654 GLboolean, const GLfloat *, uint8_t *)
655
656template <int cols>
657struct SetFloatUniformMatrixGLSL<cols, 4>
658{
659 static void Run(unsigned int arrayElementOffset,
660 unsigned int elementCount,
661 GLsizei countIn,
662 GLboolean transpose,
663 const GLfloat *value,
664 uint8_t *targetData);
665};
666
667ANGLE_SPECIALIZATION_ROWS_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(GLSL, 2, 4);
668ANGLE_SPECIALIZATION_ROWS_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(GLSL, 3, 4);
669ANGLE_SPECIALIZATION_ROWS_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(GLSL, 4, 4);
670
671#undef ANGLE_SPECIALIZATION_ROWS_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC
672
673#define ANGLE_SPECIALIZATION_COLS_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(api, cols, rows) \
674 template void SetFloatUniformMatrix##api<4, rows>::Run(unsigned int, unsigned int, GLsizei, \
675 GLboolean, const GLfloat *, uint8_t *)
676
677template <int rows>
678struct SetFloatUniformMatrixHLSL<4, rows>
679{
680 static void Run(unsigned int arrayElementOffset,
681 unsigned int elementCount,
682 GLsizei countIn,
683 GLboolean transpose,
684 const GLfloat *value,
685 uint8_t *targetData);
686};
687
688ANGLE_SPECIALIZATION_COLS_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(HLSL, 4, 2);
689ANGLE_SPECIALIZATION_COLS_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(HLSL, 4, 3);
690ANGLE_SPECIALIZATION_COLS_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC(HLSL, 4, 4);
691
692#undef ANGLE_SPECIALIZATION_COLS_SET_UNIFORM_MATRIX_FUNC
693
694template <int cols>
695void SetFloatUniformMatrixGLSL<cols, 4>::Run(unsigned int arrayElementOffset,
696 unsigned int elementCount,
697 GLsizei countIn,
698 GLboolean transpose,
699 const GLfloat *value,
700 uint8_t *targetData)
701{
702 const bool isSrcColumnMajor = !transpose;
703 if (isSrcColumnMajor)
704 {
705 // Both src and dst matrixs are has same layout,
706 // a single memcpy updates all the matrices
707 constexpr size_t srcMatrixSize = sizeof(GLfloat) * cols * 4;
708 SetFloatUniformMatrixFast(arrayElementOffset, elementCount, countIn, srcMatrixSize, value,
709 targetData);
710 }
711 else
712 {
713 // fallback to general cases
714 SetFloatUniformMatrix<false, cols, 4, true, cols, 4>(arrayElementOffset, elementCount,
715 countIn, value, targetData);
716 }
717}
718
719template <int cols, int rows>
720void SetFloatUniformMatrixGLSL<cols, rows>::Run(unsigned int arrayElementOffset,
721 unsigned int elementCount,
722 GLsizei countIn,
723 GLboolean transpose,
724 const GLfloat *value,
725 uint8_t *targetData)
726{
727 const bool isSrcColumnMajor = !transpose;
728 // GLSL expects matrix uniforms to be column-major, and each column is padded to 4 rows.
729 if (isSrcColumnMajor)
730 {
731 SetFloatUniformMatrix<true, cols, rows, true, cols, 4>(arrayElementOffset, elementCount,
732 countIn, value, targetData);
733 }
734 else
735 {
736 SetFloatUniformMatrix<false, cols, rows, true, cols, 4>(arrayElementOffset, elementCount,
737 countIn, value, targetData);
738 }
739}
740
741template <int rows>
742void SetFloatUniformMatrixHLSL<4, rows>::Run(unsigned int arrayElementOffset,
743 unsigned int elementCount,
744 GLsizei countIn,
745 GLboolean transpose,
746 const GLfloat *value,
747 uint8_t *targetData)
748{
749 const bool isSrcColumnMajor = !transpose;
750 if (!isSrcColumnMajor)
751 {
752 // Both src and dst matrixs are has same layout,
753 // a single memcpy updates all the matrices
754 constexpr size_t srcMatrixSize = sizeof(GLfloat) * 4 * rows;
755 SetFloatUniformMatrixFast(arrayElementOffset, elementCount, countIn, srcMatrixSize, value,
756 targetData);
757 }
758 else
759 {
760 // fallback to general cases
761 SetFloatUniformMatrix<true, 4, rows, false, 4, rows>(arrayElementOffset, elementCount,
762 countIn, value, targetData);
763 }
764}
765
766template <int cols, int rows>
767void SetFloatUniformMatrixHLSL<cols, rows>::Run(unsigned int arrayElementOffset,
768 unsigned int elementCount,
769 GLsizei countIn,
770 GLboolean transpose,
771 const GLfloat *value,
772 uint8_t *targetData)
773{
774 const bool isSrcColumnMajor = !transpose;
775 // Internally store matrices as row-major to accomodate HLSL matrix indexing. Each row is
776 // padded to 4 columns.
777 if (!isSrcColumnMajor)
778 {
779 SetFloatUniformMatrix<false, cols, rows, false, 4, rows>(arrayElementOffset, elementCount,
780 countIn, value, targetData);
781 }
782 else
783 {
784 SetFloatUniformMatrix<true, cols, rows, false, 4, rows>(arrayElementOffset, elementCount,
785 countIn, value, targetData);
786 }
787}
788
789template void GetMatrixUniform<GLint>(GLenum, GLint *, const GLint *, bool);
790template void GetMatrixUniform<GLuint>(GLenum, GLuint *, const GLuint *, bool);
791
792void GetMatrixUniform(GLenum type, GLfloat *dataOut, const GLfloat *source, bool transpose)
793{
794 int columns = gl::VariableColumnCount(type);
795 int rows = gl::VariableRowCount(type);
796 for (GLint col = 0; col < columns; ++col)
797 {
798 for (GLint row = 0; row < rows; ++row)
799 {
800 GLfloat *outptr = dataOut + ((col * rows) + row);
801 const GLfloat *inptr =
802 transpose ? source + ((row * 4) + col) : source + ((col * 4) + row);
803 *outptr = *inptr;
804 }
805 }
806}
807
808template <typename NonFloatT>
809void GetMatrixUniform(GLenum type, NonFloatT *dataOut, const NonFloatT *source, bool transpose)
810{
811 UNREACHABLE();
812}
813
814const angle::Format &GetFormatFromFormatType(GLenum format, GLenum type)
815{
816 GLenum sizedInternalFormat = gl::GetInternalFormatInfo(format, type).sizedInternalFormat;
817 angle::FormatID angleFormatID = angle::Format::InternalFormatToID(sizedInternalFormat);
818 return angle::Format::Get(angleFormatID);
819}
820
821angle::Result ComputeStartVertex(ContextImpl *contextImpl,
822 const gl::IndexRange &indexRange,
823 GLint baseVertex,
824 GLint *firstVertexOut)
825{
826 // The entire index range should be within the limits of a 32-bit uint because the largest
827 // GL index type is GL_UNSIGNED_INT.
828 ASSERT(indexRange.start <= std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max() &&
829 indexRange.end <= std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max());
830
831 // The base vertex is only used in DrawElementsIndirect. Given the assertion above and the
832 // type of mBaseVertex (GLint), adding them both as 64-bit ints is safe.
833 int64_t startVertexInt64 =
834 static_cast<int64_t>(baseVertex) + static_cast<int64_t>(indexRange.start);
835
836 // OpenGL ES 3.2 spec section 10.5: "Behavior of DrawElementsOneInstance is undefined if the
837 // vertex ID is negative for any element"
838 ANGLE_CHECK_GL_MATH(contextImpl, startVertexInt64 >= 0);
839
840 // OpenGL ES 3.2 spec section 10.5: "If the vertex ID is larger than the maximum value
841 // representable by type, it should behave as if the calculation were upconverted to 32-bit
842 // unsigned integers(with wrapping on overflow conditions)." ANGLE does not fully handle
843 // these rules, an overflow error is returned if the start vertex cannot be stored in a
844 // 32-bit signed integer.
845 ANGLE_CHECK_GL_MATH(contextImpl, startVertexInt64 <= std::numeric_limits<GLint>::max());
846
847 *firstVertexOut = static_cast<GLint>(startVertexInt64);
848 return angle::Result::Continue;
849}
850
851angle::Result GetVertexRangeInfo(const gl::Context *context,
852 GLint firstVertex,
853 GLsizei vertexOrIndexCount,
854 gl::DrawElementsType indexTypeOrInvalid,
855 const void *indices,
856 GLint baseVertex,
857 GLint *startVertexOut,
858 size_t *vertexCountOut)
859{
860 if (indexTypeOrInvalid != gl::DrawElementsType::InvalidEnum)
861 {
862 gl::IndexRange indexRange;
863 ANGLE_TRY(context->getState().getVertexArray()->getIndexRange(
864 context, indexTypeOrInvalid, vertexOrIndexCount, indices, &indexRange));
865 ANGLE_TRY(ComputeStartVertex(context->getImplementation(), indexRange, baseVertex,
866 startVertexOut));
867 *vertexCountOut = indexRange.vertexCount();
868 }
869 else
870 {
871 *startVertexOut = firstVertex;
872 *vertexCountOut = vertexOrIndexCount;
873 }
874 return angle::Result::Continue;
875}
876
877gl::Rectangle ClipRectToScissor(const gl::State &glState, const gl::Rectangle &rect, bool invertY)
878{
879 // If the scissor test isn't enabled, assume it has infinite size. Its intersection with the
880 // rect would be the rect itself.
881 //
882 // Note that on Vulkan, returning this (as opposed to a fixed max-int-sized rect) could lead to
883 // unnecessary pipeline creations if two otherwise identical pipelines are used on framebuffers
884 // with different sizes. If such usage is observed in an application, we should investigate
885 // possible optimizations.
886 if (!glState.isScissorTestEnabled())
887 {
888 return rect;
889 }
890
891 gl::Rectangle clippedRect;
892 if (!gl::ClipRectangle(glState.getScissor(), rect, &clippedRect))
893 {
894 return gl::Rectangle();
895 }
896
897 if (invertY)
898 {
899 clippedRect.y = rect.height - clippedRect.y - clippedRect.height;
900 }
901
902 return clippedRect;
903}
904
905void LogFeatureStatus(const angle::FeatureSetBase &features,
906 const std::vector<std::string> &featureNames,
907 bool enabled)
908{
909 for (const std::string &name : featureNames)
910 {
911 if (features.getFeatures().find(name) != features.getFeatures().end())
912 {
913 INFO() << "Feature: " << name << (enabled ? " enabled" : " disabled");
914 }
915 else
916 {
917 WARN() << "Feature: " << name << " is not a valid feature name.";
918 }
919 }
920}
921
922void ApplyFeatureOverrides(angle::FeatureSetBase *features, const egl::DisplayState &state)
923{
924 features->overrideFeatures(state.featureOverridesEnabled, true);
925 features->overrideFeatures(state.featureOverridesDisabled, false);
926
927 // Override with environment as well.
928 constexpr char kAngleFeatureOverridesEnabledEnvName[] = "ANGLE_FEATURE_OVERRIDES_ENABLED";
929 constexpr char kAngleFeatureOverridesDisabledEnvName[] = "ANGLE_FEATURE_OVERRIDES_DISABLED";
930 constexpr char kAngleFeatureOverridesEnabledPropertyName[] =
931 "debug.angle.feature_overrides_enabled";
932 constexpr char kAngleFeatureOverridesDisabledPropertyName[] =
933 "debug.angle.feature_overrides_disabled";
934 std::vector<std::string> overridesEnabled =
935 angle::GetCachedStringsFromEnvironmentVarOrAndroidProperty(
936 kAngleFeatureOverridesEnabledEnvName, kAngleFeatureOverridesEnabledPropertyName, ":");
937 std::vector<std::string> overridesDisabled =
938 angle::GetCachedStringsFromEnvironmentVarOrAndroidProperty(
939 kAngleFeatureOverridesDisabledEnvName, kAngleFeatureOverridesDisabledPropertyName, ":");
940 features->overrideFeatures(overridesEnabled, true);
941 LogFeatureStatus(*features, overridesEnabled, true);
942
943 features->overrideFeatures(overridesDisabled, false);
944 LogFeatureStatus(*features, overridesDisabled, false);
945}
946
947void GetSamplePosition(GLsizei sampleCount, size_t index, GLfloat *xy)
948{
949 ASSERT(gl::isPow2(sampleCount));
950 if (sampleCount > 16)
951 {
952 // Vulkan (and D3D11) doesn't have standard sample positions for 32 and 64 samples (and no
953 // drivers are known to support that many samples)
954 xy[0] = 0.5f;
955 xy[1] = 0.5f;
956 }
957 else
958 {
959 size_t indexKey = static_cast<size_t>(gl::log2(sampleCount));
960 ASSERT(indexKey < kSamplePositions.size() &&
961 (2 * index + 1) < kSamplePositions[indexKey].size());
962
963 xy[0] = kSamplePositions[indexKey][2 * index];
964 xy[1] = kSamplePositions[indexKey][2 * index + 1];
965 }
966}
967
968// These macros are to avoid code too much duplication for variations of multi draw types
969#define DRAW_ARRAYS__ contextImpl->drawArrays(context, mode, firsts[drawID], counts[drawID])
970#define DRAW_ARRAYS_INSTANCED_ \
971 contextImpl->drawArraysInstanced(context, mode, firsts[drawID], counts[drawID], \
972 instanceCounts[drawID])
973#define DRAW_ELEMENTS__ \
974 contextImpl->drawElements(context, mode, counts[drawID], type, indices[drawID])
975#define DRAW_ELEMENTS_INSTANCED_ \
976 contextImpl->drawElementsInstanced(context, mode, counts[drawID], type, indices[drawID], \
977 instanceCounts[drawID])
978#define DRAW_ARRAYS_INSTANCED_BASE_INSTANCE \
979 contextImpl->drawArraysInstancedBaseInstance(context, mode, firsts[drawID], counts[drawID], \
980 instanceCounts[drawID], baseInstances[drawID])
981#define DRAW_ELEMENTS_INSTANCED_BASE_VERTEX_BASE_INSTANCE \
982 contextImpl->drawElementsInstancedBaseVertexBaseInstance( \
983 context, mode, counts[drawID], type, indices[drawID], instanceCounts[drawID], \
984 baseVertices[drawID], baseInstances[drawID])
985#define DRAW_CALL(drawType, instanced, bvbi) DRAW_##drawType##instanced##bvbi
986
987#define MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(drawType, instanced, bvbi, hasDrawID, hasBaseVertex, hasBaseInstance) \
988 for (GLsizei drawID = 0; drawID < drawcount; ++drawID) \
989 { \
990 if (ANGLE_NOOP_DRAW(instanced)) \
991 { \
992 continue; \
993 } \
994 ANGLE_SET_DRAW_ID_UNIFORM(hasDrawID)(drawID); \
995 ANGLE_SET_BASE_VERTEX_UNIFORM(hasBaseVertex)(baseVertices[drawID]); \
996 ANGLE_SET_BASE_INSTANCE_UNIFORM(hasBaseInstance)(baseInstances[drawID]); \
997 ANGLE_TRY(DRAW_CALL(drawType, instanced, bvbi)); \
998 ANGLE_MARK_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_USAGE(instanced); \
999 gl::MarkShaderStorageUsage(context); \
1000 }
1001
1002angle::Result MultiDrawArraysGeneral(ContextImpl *contextImpl,
1003 const gl::Context *context,
1004 gl::PrimitiveMode mode,
1005 const GLint *firsts,
1006 const GLsizei *counts,
1007 GLsizei drawcount)
1008{
1009 gl::Program *programObject = context->getState().getLinkedProgram(context);
1010 const bool hasDrawID = programObject && programObject->hasDrawIDUniform();
1011 if (hasDrawID)
1012 {
1013 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ARRAYS, _, _, 1, 0, 0)
1014 }
1015 else
1016 {
1017 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ARRAYS, _, _, 0, 0, 0)
1018 }
1019
1020 return angle::Result::Continue;
1021}
1022
1023angle::Result MultiDrawArraysInstancedGeneral(ContextImpl *contextImpl,
1024 const gl::Context *context,
1025 gl::PrimitiveMode mode,
1026 const GLint *firsts,
1027 const GLsizei *counts,
1028 const GLsizei *instanceCounts,
1029 GLsizei drawcount)
1030{
1031 gl::Program *programObject = context->getState().getLinkedProgram(context);
1032 const bool hasDrawID = programObject && programObject->hasDrawIDUniform();
1033 if (hasDrawID)
1034 {
1035 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ARRAYS, _INSTANCED, _, 1, 0, 0)
1036 }
1037 else
1038 {
1039 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ARRAYS, _INSTANCED, _, 0, 0, 0)
1040 }
1041
1042 return angle::Result::Continue;
1043}
1044
1045angle::Result MultiDrawElementsGeneral(ContextImpl *contextImpl,
1046 const gl::Context *context,
1047 gl::PrimitiveMode mode,
1048 const GLsizei *counts,
1049 gl::DrawElementsType type,
1050 const GLvoid *const *indices,
1051 GLsizei drawcount)
1052{
1053 gl::Program *programObject = context->getState().getLinkedProgram(context);
1054 const bool hasDrawID = programObject && programObject->hasDrawIDUniform();
1055 if (hasDrawID)
1056 {
1057 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ELEMENTS, _, _, 1, 0, 0)
1058 }
1059 else
1060 {
1061 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ELEMENTS, _, _, 0, 0, 0)
1062 }
1063
1064 return angle::Result::Continue;
1065}
1066
1067angle::Result MultiDrawElementsInstancedGeneral(ContextImpl *contextImpl,
1068 const gl::Context *context,
1069 gl::PrimitiveMode mode,
1070 const GLsizei *counts,
1071 gl::DrawElementsType type,
1072 const GLvoid *const *indices,
1073 const GLsizei *instanceCounts,
1074 GLsizei drawcount)
1075{
1076 gl::Program *programObject = context->getState().getLinkedProgram(context);
1077 const bool hasDrawID = programObject && programObject->hasDrawIDUniform();
1078 if (hasDrawID)
1079 {
1080 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ELEMENTS, _INSTANCED, _, 1, 0, 0)
1081 }
1082 else
1083 {
1084 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ELEMENTS, _INSTANCED, _, 0, 0, 0)
1085 }
1086
1087 return angle::Result::Continue;
1088}
1089
1090angle::Result MultiDrawArraysInstancedBaseInstanceGeneral(ContextImpl *contextImpl,
1091 const gl::Context *context,
1092 gl::PrimitiveMode mode,
1093 const GLint *firsts,
1094 const GLsizei *counts,
1095 const GLsizei *instanceCounts,
1096 const GLuint *baseInstances,
1097 GLsizei drawcount)
1098{
1099 gl::Program *programObject = context->getState().getLinkedProgram(context);
1100 const bool hasDrawID = programObject && programObject->hasDrawIDUniform();
1101 const bool hasBaseInstance = programObject && programObject->hasBaseInstanceUniform();
1102 ResetBaseVertexBaseInstance resetUniforms(programObject, false, hasBaseInstance);
1103
1104 if (hasDrawID && hasBaseInstance)
1105 {
1106 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ARRAYS, _INSTANCED, _BASE_INSTANCE, 1, 0, 1)
1107 }
1108 else if (hasDrawID)
1109 {
1110 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ARRAYS, _INSTANCED, _BASE_INSTANCE, 1, 0, 0)
1111 }
1112 else if (hasBaseInstance)
1113 {
1114 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ARRAYS, _INSTANCED, _BASE_INSTANCE, 0, 0, 1)
1115 }
1116 else
1117 {
1118 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ARRAYS, _INSTANCED, _BASE_INSTANCE, 0, 0, 0)
1119 }
1120
1121 return angle::Result::Continue;
1122}
1123
1124angle::Result MultiDrawElementsInstancedBaseVertexBaseInstanceGeneral(ContextImpl *contextImpl,
1125 const gl::Context *context,
1126 gl::PrimitiveMode mode,
1127 const GLsizei *counts,
1128 gl::DrawElementsType type,
1129 const GLvoid *const *indices,
1130 const GLsizei *instanceCounts,
1131 const GLint *baseVertices,
1132 const GLuint *baseInstances,
1133 GLsizei drawcount)
1134{
1135 gl::Program *programObject = context->getState().getLinkedProgram(context);
1136 const bool hasDrawID = programObject && programObject->hasDrawIDUniform();
1137 const bool hasBaseVertex = programObject && programObject->hasBaseVertexUniform();
1138 const bool hasBaseInstance = programObject && programObject->hasBaseInstanceUniform();
1139 ResetBaseVertexBaseInstance resetUniforms(programObject, hasBaseVertex, hasBaseInstance);
1140
1141 if (hasDrawID)
1142 {
1143 if (hasBaseVertex)
1144 {
1145 if (hasBaseInstance)
1146 {
1147 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ELEMENTS, _INSTANCED, _BASE_VERTEX_BASE_INSTANCE, 1, 1, 1)
1148 }
1149 else
1150 {
1151 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ELEMENTS, _INSTANCED, _BASE_VERTEX_BASE_INSTANCE, 1, 1, 0)
1152 }
1153 }
1154 else
1155 {
1156 if (hasBaseInstance)
1157 {
1158 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ELEMENTS, _INSTANCED, _BASE_VERTEX_BASE_INSTANCE, 1, 0, 1)
1159 }
1160 else
1161 {
1162 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ELEMENTS, _INSTANCED, _BASE_VERTEX_BASE_INSTANCE, 1, 0, 0)
1163 }
1164 }
1165 }
1166 else
1167 {
1168 if (hasBaseVertex)
1169 {
1170 if (hasBaseInstance)
1171 {
1172 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ELEMENTS, _INSTANCED, _BASE_VERTEX_BASE_INSTANCE, 0, 1, 1)
1173 }
1174 else
1175 {
1176 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ELEMENTS, _INSTANCED, _BASE_VERTEX_BASE_INSTANCE, 0, 1, 0)
1177 }
1178 }
1179 else
1180 {
1181 if (hasBaseInstance)
1182 {
1183 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ELEMENTS, _INSTANCED, _BASE_VERTEX_BASE_INSTANCE, 0, 0, 1)
1184 }
1185 else
1186 {
1187 MULTI_DRAW_BLOCK(ELEMENTS, _INSTANCED, _BASE_VERTEX_BASE_INSTANCE, 0, 0, 0)
1188 }
1189 }
1190 }
1191
1192 return angle::Result::Continue;
1193}
1194
1195ResetBaseVertexBaseInstance::ResetBaseVertexBaseInstance(gl::Program *programObject,
1196 bool resetBaseVertex,
1197 bool resetBaseInstance)
1198 : mProgramObject(programObject),
1199 mResetBaseVertex(resetBaseVertex),
1200 mResetBaseInstance(resetBaseInstance)
1201{}
1202
1203ResetBaseVertexBaseInstance::~ResetBaseVertexBaseInstance()
1204{
1205 if (mProgramObject)
1206 {
1207 // Reset emulated uniforms to zero to avoid affecting other draw calls
1208 if (mResetBaseVertex)
1209 {
1210 mProgramObject->setBaseVertexUniform(0);
1211 }
1212
1213 if (mResetBaseInstance)
1214 {
1215 mProgramObject->setBaseInstanceUniform(0);
1216 }
1217 }
1218}
